organic_results.title: Determinants of elementary school grading
organic_results.snippet: This article examines the determinants of the grades teachers give to students. It distinguishes such meritocratic sources of grades as the student's widely valued and classroom-specific achievements (the former measured by standardized test scores) from such nonmeritocratic sources as race, sex, and track level. The data trace one cohort in a single school district as it passes through the first, second, and third grades. We use three-stage least-squares analysis to estimate separate nonrecursive models for reading and …

publication_info.summary: J Leiter, JS Brown - Sociology of Education, 1985 - JSTOR
